questions.question: During the deliveraly stage, how might an attacker deliver an SQL Injection payload?
questions.optionA: When user is asked for input username
questions.optionB: When user is asked for input captcha
questions.optionC: When user is asked for input password
questions.optionD: When user is asked to logout
questions.answer: When user is asked for input username
questions.stage: Reconnaissence: The attacker gathers information about the target system, identifying potential vulnerabilities or weak points in the security measures.

questions.question: Which of the following is the type of SQL Injection attack
questions.stage: Weaponization: The attacker creates a malicious SQL query that can exploit the identified vulnerabilities.

questions.question: Which of the following is true about an SQL Injection attack
questions.stage: Delivery: The attacker delivers the malicious SQL query to the target system. This could be through a form input on a website, for example

questions.question: How can we prevent a SQL Injection Attack?
questions.optionA: Admin accounts should not be used
questions.optionB: Access Privileges should be restricted for for users
questions.optionC: Sanitize user input before login for validation
questions.stage: Exploitation: The malicious SQL query is executed on the target system, exploiting the vulnerability

questions.question: Which of the following statements should be used in your SQL code?
